reviewText:
Kingwom Wars I still remember my thrill when I heard about this game being released. If I had to explain this game in one sentence it would be: The game is like Travian, Tribal Wars, ... but in real time 3D RTS mode.

I have little play time on steam, that is because steam release was buggy at start, it payed off more to play using official launcher, meaning not using steam. The gameplay is simple, you start with a town which you upgrade. It has no deep depth of techology, it is rather simple and straight forward. You do not even need super strong economy to get decent army. I mostly play Elfs since I find their economy and troops most suitable to me (Archers :) ). Game has single player and multiplayer side which do no differ too much. You can play singleplayer offline with no problems, multiplayer gets you closer to other players. Multiplyer is same as singleplayer but you can go into CO-OP battles with other players, either with or against them. Maximum players inbattle are 2v2, which is kinda limiting. Guild/Clan/Alliance has meaning in terms helping each other during attacks. Game itself looks like Total wars series where troops and cities are managed on global map, while battle itself is in spirit of total war series where 2 armies clash. Combat system is same as with total war series archers(mounted, foot, crossbows), infantry(heavy knights, pikemen, swordsmen), cavalry (one type mounted knight, elfs have mounted archers), monsters with orcs etc. Each unit formation could lvl till 20 and had stat points for you to manually upgrade which provides decent ammount of depth. Each unit type has its special skills, where some have to be researched using crows, which are acquired with battles and quests.

At start it was that simple, during time game developers kept close contact with comunity and invested great time to fixing bugs and providing new content. At release time game was once time purchase, now it is free to play model with premium. New content added mages, dragons, dwarfs, new heroes/special units, sieges but for all of it you need massive ammount of crowns which arent easy to get. There are also some bugs where you spend 250 crowns, but s*it happens, server reverses your upgrade and town state and u lose 250 crowns which finally made me quit game.

Game itself is fun and worth playing, developers are moving forward and wont forsake the game, but KW2 is comming and you can feel that they are more focused on that release. Have fun it is nice game.

reviewText:
I have follwed this title since beta, I pre ordered the game and played it on off for years. It was the first true mmorts in my eyes, the dream of a persistant age of empires game or similar really came true here.

During the transition to Steam I lost my account so I decided to start again on here as a free to play.

I can honestly say from having a paid account I have managed to reach exactly where I was before for free. there are no pay walls or timers to get around. Most of the paid stuff is cosmentic however given the poor visuals it doesn't look great.

Pro's: Gameplay, the feeling of laying siege to a town and carefully planning your strategy is great. This game is for the slow methodical players, rush competitive gamers will find it lacking.

Con's: Graphically dated and the interface is really clumsy!

reviewText:
After playing this game for 12 hours it's clear this is a free to play, or pay to win game (just about pay to play).  The developers say they aren't going for that pay to win game however the time it takes to build anything is staggering without paying.  Everything in the game costs crowns which you earn by completing quests, killing a players army, playing co-op, or defending your keep.  By no means a small amount of crowns either so basic upgrades cost 10~120 crowns each.  Note that defending your keep doesn't happen often enough to make gathering crowns in that manor a viable option.  You can purchase crowns which makes the game go quicker as you also get gold when you do this to boot.  Thus making the game actually playable if you pay.

The delevopers give out a starting bonus deal to help new players get into the game.  Compared to how slow the game moves, the bonus didn't make that much difference.  The issues is simple resource generation bonus for 10 minuts at the x10, x8, x6, and x4 level, and a 5 hour x2 resource generation.  I stopped playing before that ran out as I couldn't imagine playing the game at normal resource generation without pulling my hair out.  You also won't get attacked by anything for the first 24 hours.  To be honest I cancelled the protection as soon as I started to see if I would even get attacked at all.  I didn't at 12 hours of play get attacked once.  Which kind of makes having a walled village pointless.

The game itself has a good concept.  The graphics are okay but not great, the sounds, and music is garbage, the game play is kind of interesting.  The bugs are many.  The biggest issue is that it's a 100% server sided game.  I can log out and get more resources than I can while playing due to the lag between the server and my game.  I have an above average rig that can handle any game out on ultra settings so no it's not my computer.  If your army dies there is a glitch that doesn't reset your population count at your home base cuasing some issues trying to rebuild an army.

The main reason I don't recommend this game is becuase there is so much work involved with building an army after you get defeated, or even just play and win a battle.  Compaired to the loot you receive from a battle the cost of building an army is crazy.  An army can cost around 1,000 resources per unit with an army cap of 90 units it can get expensive.  The first major battle in the game requires around 25 units to beat.  However the losses are about 20 units.  The treasure gained is around 2,000 gold and about 400 wood and a crown or 2.  The 20 units cost around 30,000 food, and about 15,000 gold.  You don't gain land, units, or anything else in the first major battle.  It was cool to watch just not cool enough to waste 5 hours rebuilding another army to go on the next mission.

The peasant AI is horrible as well, and the gathering of resources is limited at best.  Some of the peasant resource gathering upgrades are bugged and actually don't improve what they say they will.  Which is similar to placing buildings, some locations are even bugged and you can't place anything there.  You have to choose wisely what you will place as you are limited to so many slots unless you get an upgrade to the slots of buildings you can place.  Which also requires crowns, and a lot of them.

The population cap in town might be to blame for everything wrong with the game.  With a glitch that doesn't calculate the population correctly, to not showing you all of your peasants when you click on the view all button it would seem the developers haven't finished this game yet.  The population cap is sitting at 90.  While I was able to max mine out at 50 in town after having to use population for animals to get extra food resources I found that I couldn't generate enough to build an army of 30 in a day.  It took about 5 hours to get a army of 25 going.  After that main battle which lasted about 5 minutes.  Having to rebuild all but 4 of those units there simply wasn't enough motivation to continue playing the game.

If the developer reads this I would recommend focusing on fixing any bugs the game has.  I would also lower the cost to upgrade anything with crowns in the game.  I would also rewrite the treasure you get after a battle to match the size of the battle, and the losses you will take on at an even matched battle.  If you lose you get nothing, if you win you get enough to at least repair, or rebuild most of your army.  The resource generation is so slow that it would take weeks to get anthing interesting going not to mention all the crowns I'd need just to upgrade my town hall to a castle might take months.  I would recommend changing the population cap to 100 for peasants, or fix the resource generation to make the game pace faster.  Playing 1 battle every few hours is dull and boring after all.  As the name of the game isn't kingdom building it's kingdom war. Compared to other games out there I can play that in this genra this game comes in as boring, and slow at best.  It has a ton of potential to be great, it just simply isn't at this time.

reviewText:
A game targeted at all Stronghold, LOTR:BFME, and Age of Empire fans.

Task villagers to harvest resources, build up your castle/stronghold, raise armies to go questing/clearing areas/sieging/pvp, all while the units in said armies gain ranks and can become quite powerful.

Battles take place Total War style, the only setback is the fact that unit collision has little to no effect, battalions don't stick together, so tactics have a somewhat reduced effect here. Bringing villagers to battle is actually mandatory, because looting the fallen yields amazing amounts of resources, especially from PVP.

After any PVP (field battle or siege) you get some PVP protection time, so you're not overwhelmed from annoyingly nonstop PVP. Although, keepi in mind that the rewards from participating in PVP are quite bountiful. If you don't want to participate, a small bribe is possible, which is proportional to the army size. Smaller armies = smaller payouts. You do get PVP protection after a payout so it is possible to skip the whole PVP deal alltogether.

There is a special resource (crowns) which is necessary for all upgrades and high level units. It comes quite slowly at the beginning, but are most certainly attainable without paying real money. Ammasing gold is the way here, because crowns can be bought for gold at a rate of 1:5000. A solid economy is key, which is a must for any player of this type of game.

Solid game, If you loved Stronghold, BFME, or Age of Empires you should definitely try this one.

reviewText:
Free to play game.Also as an RTS is very balanced and the AI is pretty intelligent.
Those 3 races you can play(elf,orc,human)and the existence of dwarfes(which you can also use in combat) + dragons and other creatures makes you feel like you are playing Lord of the Rings,and the combat makes you feel like you are playing Total War.Even it is Free to play,it is not a Pay to Win game,so you can simly be as good as others that pay.

reviewText:
Honestly i have been serching for a game like this for a very very long time.  This game gives everyone thee own estate and lordship in a fantasy mideval society.  In this estate you manage your troops your people and recorce income.  As you progress in the game you go from small town to massive fortress with many various maps to start your town on.  The combat is were the game truly shines however.  When you go to attack a enemy stronghold it takes alot fo preperation examineing eney fortifications trying to find the best point of attack.  And there is always the option to battle against players and npc settlements either solo or co op.  At the end of the battle there is nothing quite as satisfying as seeing your enemys walls fall to your armies.

The pvp element in this game encompases the majority of the game but if you are like me you can choose not to participate.  When you start you get a little featuer called battle protection this keeps other players from attacking your settlement.  This initial protection last 24 hours now at first you think 24 hours real time but no its 24 hours of game play in your current game and there is a in game option to extend that time.  So if you are like me and enjoy just playing the many quests you recive and building your settlement up you can do that without fear of getting attacked.  Another great thing is that if your protection is off and you are attacked you ca only be attacked wile you are logged in and then only if the attacking army is eaqually as powerful as yours so it is always a fair fight.  And should you choose to not fight you can pay the other player a tribute to keep from fighting.

All in all this is probably the best mideval strategy game I have ever played.

reviewText:
A strategic and tactical middleage war game i find difficult to compare with other ones i played.

Strategic, a bit of RPG, tactical, Business, Timeintensive, older graphic type

Mostly i would make a compare with age of empires genre to build units and get them to action, but in difference it remembered me to such browsergames, because of the time you have to wait on your constructions till they are ready.

Bulding a fortress with all things a middleage settlergame u imagine and take units out of three races and some special units like mighty dragons. Every Unit of every Race is for every player getable without paying money.

As one of the old users (i bought the game times ago) i know there is such a massive progress in debugging and improving this game - nearly unbelieveable. This process isn´t still at its end and there are still some big points of loosing enthusiasm. But i have to admit, that there is a strange element in this game, that forces me to play again and again everytime for a while and to explore the hole game.

Good for me:

- Business system with some tricky elements to provide my progress, like peasant armys, Vassals producing ressources,
- new progress poossibilities with all the buildings .. now it´s not still all researched after 3 days .. Thats very important for me. I want to have aims in game and there are still a few, that i didn´t reached all the time. Aims of Quests or Aims of my desire
- mixing and combining armys in any comination.. Great, not one skilled army for all tasks
- enough possibilies to get this crones, with which you can buy anything in addition to ressources (not pay to win)
- great pve battles - army vs army or amry vs castle ..
- great support by nice players all around
- good quest system
- the possibility to go many way to win.. every unit works fine on its wise. --> Not only one way to make a strong and functioning army

Disadvantages of the game

- Still since my starting its very slow in every discipline. Commands and orders have a standard delay of ca 1 sec
--> this delay raises in pvp battles up to 4 sec. and graphic settings don´t change that. Because of that pvp isn´t still playable in my eyes
- not answering gamesupport
- not comprehensible effects of life reg on the different units.. a dragon with 50 life reg / s will not have over 10 life reg / real second. Knights instead can regenerate massive life - surely with their greater number of part-units
- sometimes its dificult to find out the reason for missing the friend for an coop game.


Since it is free to play i can recommend this game and minimum 10 hours that u will see a bit of the content

This game is for you, if you like to get part by part stronger by saving up for mighty units and leveling all units and finding your own tactical way

reviewText:
Found the game a week ago - right after it went F2P, and decided to give it a try.
I played Stronghold Kingdoms for about 8 months, so this seemed like a good fit.

In a very real way, Kingdom Wars is everything that Stronghold Kingdoms should have done - but didn't.
1. Quests.
2. City inside of the Castle.
3. Army vs Army.
4. RTS battles
5. NO P2W
6. Partial Victories/Defeats with retreating and paying off ransoms.
7. Real terrain which the castles are built around.

The Devs are very active and there has been small patches every day.  Find a bug?  Report it and it gets fixed THAT DAY.  Are there things about Kingdom Wars which I hope get attention from the Dev team?  Absolutely - but so far, I'm liking what I'm seeing.  A lot.

reviewText: The strum of a lute serenades my ears as my peasants dutiful mine on my homeland, carrying sacks of stone and gold, tending my fields, butchering livestock, and working hard in the forests surrounding my large keep with it's mighty stone walls. A babbling brook works through my stronghold as my men patrol the walls with crossbows, blunderbusses, and bows at the ready. Bubbling oil gurgles away at the top of my gatehouses waiting to pour onto those who'd dare breach the sancitity of my realm. Trebutchets sit atop round towers waiting for the drums of war. My quiet management of my fief is piereced by the panoply of trumpets hearlding a welp who dares to raze my homeland. So I herd my peasants in and lock the gatehouses. I assemble my personal guard to the outer courtyard and lock the inner gatehouse. The enemy arrives at the edge of my walls and my trebutchets begin to sing with the whistle of flying boulders and the swipp" of arrows leaving their strings. My men bubble out from a far gatehouse and make battle with the enemy on the fields and ruins of my homeland's outfields. They are bloodied but are victorious
date:
the enemy driven before them.  The gates open and the peasants return to their tasks. The lutes play again and the once again peace falls over my land. It feels good to be lord.


Kingdom Wars is a PVE/PVP oriented MMORTS where you are lord of a tiny homestead on a vast and deeply detailed world of Mythador. Populated with Orcs
hoursPlayed: and Humans it reminds me deeply of Tolkien's Lord of the Rings but with a distinct Reverie Worlds spin. You can choose a race
voteText: two traits
helpfulPercent: and three different homelands that help give your kingdom a unique feel as well as mechanical benefits. You can engage in PVE quests or PVP content with additional Co-OP offerings. By far my favorite MMORTS to date and has hours upon hours of enjoyment."

reviewText:
This is a giant timewaster of a game. If you ever played a facebook cow clicker game, this is basically the steam version of those. It's free, sure, but I still think I paid too much for it.
It feels like I spent 95% of my time spent playing this doing nothing but waiting for enough resources to get the basic economy of my settlement going. I literally just sit and wait or play other games so that I can have enough resources to build a single building, and even that takes hours.  Then I logged out and when I came back later, the new building was just gone again, along with the resources.
This game is a buggy mess, like so many reviewers have mentioned before. I had quests bug out, forcing me to restart the entire quest line because the dialogue happened in the main game screen, then the dialog scene began and there was no way to exit it again. I was even able to get the rewards for everything twice. Units fall through bridges before clipping back on to them correctly, sometimes the resource over time display just changes wildly for no real reason I can discern.
I could forgive that, since the strategy genre is in a bit of a decline lately and options are scarce, if the rest of the game was fun.

Well, do you enjoy watching a miniature model slowly walk across a huge map? Then you're in luck because that's what most of the game is like. The entire game is slow, slow, slow. Wait forever to get enough resources to build a handful of troops (which are pretty weak unless you upgrade the training facilities for currency, which also takes ages to gather enough of). Then spend even longer watching these units slowly trot across the map to a city or a quest location, where they will just get slaughtered.
The worst offender however is combat. There is no control to it. You can't give orders to units because for some reason, while all units are trained in squads, you cannot issue attack commands to target specific squads. You just issue an attack move in the general direction of the enemy and hope your units don't die first. If there is a trick to it, the game doesn't tell you in the tutorial or in the time I spent playing it.
And if your units aren't levelled to the maximum level, you might as well just zerg rush with all races because good luck keeping anyone alive. Units will ignore direct commands to disengage, frantically trying to rush back into the enemy army despite the squad being at 1|15 units with barely any health left. Your direct commands as player are just ignored by a batshit crazy AI that makes tactics or planning impossible.
And to top it off, the animations of the units are ugly and repetative and the graphics look a good deal worse than Spellforce 1.

reviewText:
If you've ever played an economy focused RTS like Age of Empires, built up a flourishing and efficient town over the course of a match, and then felt a twinge of sadness on the statistics screen at the loss of said town, then Kingdom Wars is a good bet. (Especially for the low low price of completely free.)

Early game you'll spend most of your time optimizing your economy. Training more peasants, setting them to mine gold or stone, gather lumber or farm the fields, meanwhile using your small starting militia to complete the basic quests.
After a day or two however that part of the game virtually disappears, with you making only a few adjustments now and then. The economy does everything it needs to, but not a lot more. The main meat of the game is BATTLE. :D

PVP works like so:
1: Put together an army that you built in your town, and bring it onto the world map.
2: Click the Search pvp" button and choose between attacking a city or fighting an army head on.
3: If you're fighting an army you'll find yourself on a small open map with some mountains and a few camps of neutral forces.
4: If you're in a siege the layout of the land can differ greatly depending on the homeland of the player. Siege weapons are required of course.
5: Rewards for winning is gold that you loot of the bodies and Crowns just for winning.

The actual combat is squad based
date: similar to Total War.\nYou can switch between different formations to optimize various types of defence
recommended: movement speed and damage. Troops will level up as they participate in battle
hoursPlayed: allowing you to spend ability points to increase their stats.\n\nIt's very worth bringing up the F2P platform
voteText: as many people shy away from games like this based on the fear of a Pay to Win barrier popping up in their way every time they were just starting to enjoy the game.\nCutting to the chase
helpfulPercent:
you don't ever need to spend money in this game. There is a currency called Crowns which you can gain through the following means:

1: Winning any ingame fight - either against the AI or players
2: Finishing quests
3: Paying for it through microtransactions

Thing is though
votesHelpful: in the case of this game you don't really pay to gain an advantage as much as you do to skip large sections of the game. Sure
votesTotal: you can buy a ton of Crowns in the store and get loads of endgame units and be matched with the best players
votesFunny: but then you lose out on all of the Battles and Sieges that
commentsCount: assumedly
column16: are the reason you are there in the first place.\n\nIt is currently not possible to actually take control of AI castles
column17: but this will be changed in an upcoming free expansion.\n\nPS: Don't pick the human female hero. The voice acting will drill it's way into your skull."

reviewText:
I want to start with the good things about Kingdom Wars first. If youre interested you can read this guide or just try out the game, but if you have a bad internet connection, you should probably read first to know more about the game itself.

The game itself is awesome. Its like freaking stronghold, but online.
Did you ever play Age of Empires? Well, if you did you probably know the economy system is awesome. Did you ever play American Conquest or Cossacks? Well, if you did you probably know the combat system is awesome. This game is a mix of those games, but massive mutliplayer. Its a so called MMORTS (Massive Multiplayer Online Real Time Strategy).

The best thing about this game is the fact that there's no pay2win.
You can pretty much archive everything ingame and there's no advantage for players paying money for things like premium or customisation.

Did you ever get bored because you would have to pay with real money to boost up building sth or training troops? Well, you wont get bored in this game, because building stuff doesnt take very long and the devs gave us nice quests to do. If you want to get ressources to get a bigger army you can make quests, loot enemies or siege a town. Trust me, I never got bored in this game and I think you wont too.

A very interesting idea is the quest system. There's some sort of story depending on the world region you are living in. For example you have fight, protect, destroy or survive during such quests. Its important to know as much as possible about the enemy to have an advantage. Every unit has a few different formations which are effective against a special type of enemy. If you siege a castle, you want to put your archers to skirmish formation so you gain a speed boost and protection against enemy ranged units. The formations vary from unit to unit and are special for each kingdoms.
There are a bunch of upgrades you can get for ressources to get better formations like the skirmish formation I mentioned above. Since the units vary from race to race (Orc, Elves, Human), its important to know your strenghts. You have to act different each time depending the enemy you conquer. That makes the game pretty exciting if you ask me.

Ive mentioned the races above and want to explain them to you. Basically there are 3 races with different units and strenghts. The orcs are very strong melee fighters. Their units are dealing heavy damage, but they have weak ranged units. Their strongholds are wood based and they use catapults as siege weapons. Its a pretty brutal race, you should try it if you dont know which race you should choose! The humans are pretty much balanced. They have medium melee fighters, medium ranged units and good cavalry. Their stronghold are wood (Palisades) and stone based (After further upgrades). They have very strong formations if you ask me. Theyve knights and mounted knights which are pretty much the strongest allrounders ingame. The elves are a race with a fantasy" lore. Their ranged units are very powerful and able to kill even heavy units easily on distance. The strongholds look cool
date: but I dont like the "fantasy" style
recommended: but its pretty much the only thing I dont like about them. Their units are interesting and the lore is great

voteText: for example the human knight. He can heal nearby troops.\nIf you got too many crowns (from battles
helpfulPercent: quests etc.) you can spend 'em on dwarves.\nDwarves have a bunch of nice units you can buy! For example you can buy a troop of miners
votesHelpful:
which are mining way faster than the normal peasents. Their siege engine is great too. They got a highrange cannon which can destroy walls like a catapult. Its pretty expensive though.
If youre more a fan of ranged units you will probably love the riflemen! They are not so expensive and are useful if you want to defend you village. The only disadvantages of dwarven troops are that they are expensive and slow.

There's also a pretty nice chat system! Its split into a few channels

reviewText: Alright, time to get a review on. I am here today to give a review to a game I don't think gets enough credit for what it does. Are you ready? Good! The game that we are going to dive into today is none other then Dawn of Fantasy Kingdom Wars. If you are not excited and you love strategy games you need to get excited because this game brings so much to the table. First off we have three different races to choose from humans, orcs, and elves, the later of which I am currently enjoying. These races are different in just enough ways to make you want to keep coming back for more. The humans may be versatile, where the orcs are tough and brutal and the elves are elegant. Don't fret there is no need to be careful on what race you pick you can have multiple armies and city's that you have built. I believe that having multiple armies is good for the game it keeps it fresh, I also like the looks on each races cities. Be careful here you can easily sink hours into the game just creating your city. This game is solid in all aspects of strategy, story, and mind numbing sieging for those of you who just want to get straight to the action. You also get heroic units that allow for fun, Mages, Minotaur, Dragons, and many other goodies. You can also customize your cities the more you put in the better your people will be protected! Now the game does have some bugs that can be frustrating. The game doesn't give you an option on whether or not you wish to participate in pvp all though it offers a buy out for the siege it does get frustrating when you are in the middle of building and you get attacked. I have listed the Pros and the Cons of this game but in all honestly you need to pick the game up its free on steam and decide for you self whether this is a go or a dump. This game does allow you to bring friends along on a siege so dust off your armor and lets get ready to go to war!  If I was to rate this game I would give it a solid 7.5 out of 10 the game has to much replay value and is definitely a trend setter in the strategy game department.

reviewText:
English is only my third language, please do not expect a Poe’s english.

Even being a strategy fan for almost a decade this game manage to completely surprised me. First, the most polemical part of a free to play game: pay to win walls. This game is a true free to play strategy game, no pay to win walls, I got everything that can be got using crowns without spending a single dime. But that is the interesting part, the game is so good that I want to spend money on it. If not by the steam's overlay problem, I would gladly by some esthetic skins or even boosters packs.

Kingdom Wars is not a game uniquely focused to multiplayer gameplay. You can play the singleplayer and by your own explore the world map the game's lore. Know that thing EA will not put in the new Stars Wars game? Kingdom War have it, and an immensely good one. And you have a lot of time to play without any multiplayer concern the singleplayer aspect of the game, because the battle protection only counts out when you’re logged in the game, so if you play two hours a day you have twelve days to enjoy the singleplayer and more important, prepare yourself for when the battle protection time expires.

Nevertheless, if you want you can play the singleplayer campaign in coop with a friend you will lose this protection, and will need to be concern with multiplayer aspects, because co-op is only possible if you both cancel the battle protection. If you just want to enjoy with a friend the lore and world map you cannot do it undisturbedly, because if you cancel the battle protection you will open the game’s multiplayer section.

Continuing, the have a large world map, if many cities to explore. Different races to interact with, and tons of others things. Definitely worth. You want to make diplomacy with the NPC cities close to you? You can. Want to conquer then all? Also can. Travel half world have interact you dwarfs and their cities, ruins and mines? Also in the game. And better, you can play as three different civilizations, humans, elves and orcs. And each one plays different and feels different Kingdom Wars is easily on of my favorite strategy games currently, the only thing that keeps this game to enter my favorite strategy games of all time is that you cannot play with a dwarven civilization. Moreover, the developers’ team is great, one of the best on steam; they are constructing a path that only makes me likes this game even more, with new huge patches and free expansions (please would you consider adding the option to play as dwarves?). At least you can have dwarven units in your army, and I loved it. Inasmuch as is not from an AAA company Kingdom Wars nails every except one aspect that a game of this genre needs. Will address this one major problem next paragraph.

There is but one thing that bugs me. The troop’s management. When you will position your troops you only see and blue arrow that indicates the direction, and gets larger or thinner. It is a hideous system, seriously.  Honestly and fairly tip: uses Total War’s system (do not need to explain how it is, everyone knows). In the new announcement concerning the new free expansion (learn from KW’s devs CA) and patches, they said they will implement the KW 2 battle system to this game, but I yet did not played KW 2 Battles, so I do not knows how it is. Maybe will fix this that is my major problem with the game, but that is yet to be seen.

Besides this last critic, I love the game. Will play for more forty hours. Easily deserves a 6/10. Considering the new announcements, I am almost sure Kingdom Wars can advance to an 7/10.

reviewText:
Kingdom wars is a MMORTS that boasts incredible F2P a great progression system and a massive variety of units.
The game plays like a massive single player campaign through your own private instance of the world map. PvP and Co-op act like random encouters for your armies and villages. PvP can be easily avoided but rewards even the loser well. Co-op sieges with randoms or friends are good fun and expose you to more strategies.
Currently the game features 3 playable races: Humans, Orcs and Elves. You choose 3 traits at the start to customise your races performance. Dwarves and Dragons are availiable as special units to all races. All races seem unique and quite balanced with the humans probably being the easiest to learn with.
Your villages and armies cannot be attacked while you are offline and attacks can be avoided very easily with small amounts of gold or  battle protection when you are.

If you ever liked any RTS game ever you should download and play this today. A really clever use of an online communitty for this genre. Hours and hours of fun for solo and social gamers alike.

9/10

reviewText:
Kingdom Wars is  ideal if you like a game you don't want you running for 24/7.   It really doesn't pay to be logged in for the sake of it.  Also you don't become punished for your success as you don't have more than one city on a server to look after and build up.  The game is perfectly playable without paying, but if you do pay the game is not particuarly unbalanced for it.  There are loads of options to invest in research, whether for better catapaults, or better yield from your farms.  You will probably want more than one standing army, each tailored for various tasks and so you will need to generate gold to train the troops, though they will slowly train by winning battles.  It is more likely you will pay for their training as it is by far the quicker and economical option.

You will probably also need help fulfilling the battles that unfold as your story progresses which apart from chat is your only avenue of co-operative play with others.   You can make friends and ask them along which, if they have an army of similar strength, they have the option to do.   Added to this, attacking others happens on a random basis so far as army matches go. If you like, you can scour the area and maek battle with innate cities/armies.

People will attack you, and if you don't have the time, or don't want to take losses you can pay them off instead, rather than fight.  So I find when I need to off load goods that my industry is generating and recruit or train more troops, I log in every few hours.   If I want to battle I log in with expectation of taking maybe an hour - some sieges demand an element of patience - and If I just want to sort out my armies, again Iog in for a while as necessary.

So although many of the sieges are similar, they are not tedious, and since some players have been at this game for a year  or two, it is sustainable and so far as things go, I think I might be found here in this land in a few years time too.

reviewText:
Kingdom wars is a MMORTS that boasts incredible F2P a great progression system and a massive variety of units.
The game plays like a massive single player campaign through your own private instance of the world map. PvP and Co-op act like random encouters for your armies and villages. PvP can be easily avoided but rewards even the loser well. Co-op sieges with randoms or friends are good fun and expose you to more strategies.
Currently the game features 3 playable races: Humans, Orcs and Elves. You choose 3 traits at the start to customise your races performance. Dwarves and Dragons are availiable as special units to all races. All races seem unique and quite balanced with the humans probably being the easiest to learn with.
Your villages and armies cannot be attacked while you are offline and attacks can be avoided very easily with small amounts of gold or  battle protection when you are.

If you ever liked any RTS game ever you should download and play this today. A really clever use of an online communitty for this genre. Hours and hours of fun for solo and social gamers alike.

9/10

I was playing nicely during a week with a prosperous elven city.

IT CRASHES! NO WAY TO GO BACK OR TO RESTORE YOUR BATTLE SIR!

You wasted a lot of effort of your time building a town, gathering resouces, amassing an army, face long hours siege for a big CRASH and you lose everything!

The developers should seriously work in the reliability of this game. Don't play it and waste your time on it now. It does not only bug an crashes during sieges, it can crash anytime.

reviewText:
I could sit here and tell you it's a great game, and it's worth the money, and you are missing out if any one says otherwise...
As a veteran of this game I can truly say out of many RTS games that go from online to single player. That Kingdom Wars has been the only game to catch my interest in years.
There is much to do, and yet so much to acomplish. The land is full of ripe adventure you just need to discover it.

This can be some what of a spoiler, but proves my point.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


I favor the orcish hordes. With being a Warleader of Orcs who will call you Grr Mada meaning great warrior in orcish. I can tell you that every race has a great and mostly unique way of making you feel like a powerful ruler, if not peaceful savior. The orcs take what they can get rather it be meat from an animal, ogre, or human alike. The elves protect their lands from taint, and brutality. They respect their land and give back. The humans prove their worth with noble tasks. Either by protecting the weak, or just simply fighting with inspiration courage.

reviewText:
Given the different behavior of the game at each connection, one wonders if the preferred method of the developers is not to copy and paste entire sections of code without really knowing what they are doing !!! A strategy game where nothing is predictable !!!

* Units lose health or disappear without reasons.
* The walls and buildings deteriorate without reason
* In your inventory, resources disappear or fluctuate without reasons -   There may be expenses for maintenance of the city, but not equivalent to a life cycle of a mine stone,  in just 30MN.
* Mines are recovering at different speeds (from a connection session to another)
* In PVP, friends or enemy units may have the same colors (a stupid choice)
* More, the NPC and players can have the same color !!
* Use the mouse to select  something is arduous

Because the automatic reset not working on the forum, I asked the  KW support. Here is their amazing response : we will reset your forum password
date: and contact you in a day or two". Many players animate and participate in forums games
recommended: so they have an idea of how they work. It should not take more than five minutes to change the information in the user management interface. 2 days and 4 even if I consider the date of my first email is not credible.\n\nDo you have had problems with your mouse or the keyboard keys since the installation of the game? Valve should have some security requirements : Valve responsibility can be clearly commit if it turns out they distribute rogue software on their plate-form. Online games may have  become a method of money  laundering for all  maffias of the world. Valve tell us if you contribute to that !!!"

reviewText:
Online realm that grows, works, lives, and breathes even when you log off.
The developers uses real-time siege combat

Gathering resources, constructing buildings and walls.
Managing our economy & watch your city progress as you upgrade.
Directing our citizens, completing quests.
We can have multiple cities & massive armies therefore its fun to manage them.

Graphics is 5 / 10, looks like Year 2008 graphic. Battle animation is terrible.

There are many issues, bugs and sometimes horrible path finding.

The game is close to dead. On average of 100 players were online each time.
There is a second version of Kingdom Wars which requires purchase.  Kingdom Wars 2: Battles

There are plenty of games in Steam to enjoy. Avoid this unless you have nothing better to do.
You might enjoy hours of building your city

reviewText:
Game is fun, very slow paced, addictive at the grow part of it, a few side missions and quests vs AI.. but i still dont recomend it due to many issues i found on the very first couple of hours of gameplay that makes the most give up fast:

-game crashes often, in one of the times it happened to me, when i logged in again some of my buildings were gone like i havent even built them. so i lost 1 hour of gameplay after playing 2 or 3 hours. wich made me to give up imediatly.

-you start a tiny village with 24h atacks free, but as you see the world map everyone else around you got a monster developed city compared to yours and you wont be able to compete after that safe time.

-chat system is crap, you can see a list of players online and talk on general chats, but you have no idea wich city belongs to who in the map, and you cant manage to contact them, or at least not in a direct user friendly way so you kinda feel alone in the world surrounded by gigantic empires you cannot fight fairly.

-game is pay to win.

reviewText:
Online realm that grows, works, lives, and breathes even when you log off.
The developers uses real-time siege combat

Gathering resources, constructing buildings and walls.
Managing our economy & watch your city progress as you upgrade.
Directing our citizens, completing quests.
We can have multiple cities & massive armies therefore its fun to manage them.

Graphics is 5 / 10, looks like Year 2008 graphic. Battle animation is terrible.

There are many issues, bugs and sometimes horrible path finding.

The game is close to dead. On average of 100 players were online each time.
There is a second version of Kingdom Wars which requires purchase.  Kingdom Wars 2: Battles

There are plenty of games in Steam to enjoy. Avoid this unless you have nothing better to do.
You might enjoy hours of building your city

The gameplay/combat resembles the lord of the rings strategy game but with a million years more waiting and crowns" which you slowly generate through battles or you can just go pay to win and purchase them with real money

hoursPlayed: i know the company has been trying hard to reduce it but i bought this game back when it was first released as dawn of fantasy a few years ago and it has yet to be improved. This game is very slow if they got rid of the crowns it would be better but i guess they have to earn money since this game failed when it wasnt free to play. Graphics are pretty good in this game but there are a few bugs such as walls not touching ends of cliffs properly so when people attack you they can just walk between the gap rather than haveing to actually attack the walls or gate and units sometimes have issues staying in groups when you put them on the walls or towers not to mention they sometimes dont shoot inside of the base from the outside walls when units swarm in. Overall this game does lack quite alot but if you want to win pvp just buy a whole lot of crown units they will overpower the average units in any battle even if you are completely outnumber crown units will be able to get you an easy win

Nice game, with nice graphics, when i've seen a free 2 play building game/war like stronghold and total wars, i thought to myself uau, this must be fantastic, and indeed it was on the first month.

But the game became bad, has many bugs, wich ruins the game, the game has a story, thats good, and is online.

I tried now, after the team said, ' a new update is comming ' i've read the email, i installed the game... and, my account has been deleted, somehow idk, but i wasnot the only one with the same problem. btw, this game was really nice, and still really nice, but after my acc problem, and the servers issues, i will totally leave the game. Best regards kingdom wars team, this game has potential... but you're ruining your hard work since 2013...

reviewText:
The issue is that Dawn of Fantasy is not a good MMORTS. For most computers you are going to be playing on low and still experience mind numbing lag from the tiniest seige battles at the beggining of the game. Resource gathering has nothing to it, nor do things like skill. Tech tree is tiny, you will have built everything by hour three and thus has every unit for your faction.

Then lets go to the combat. Every unit you create at home has a level up system, which much be activated manually for each of the 30-40 units you feild. Thats right, before every battle you have to individually level up every single unit. I was playing orcs, and this got boring by the time I had a screen full of goblins.

Kingdom wars is not a good game, and Reverie is under the impression if they keep adding tiny packs of content to the game it's suddenly going to fix every problem in their games code; or better yet suddenly turn their game into a strategy title. You won't experience multiplayer, nobody plays.

reviewText:
the game is getting old now at least 3 years old and graphics seem much older than that

the game is great fun when running right the best  mmorts ive played
get to level up uints and asign points where you want them so can have tank dps or jack of trades all in the same unit type if you wanted

reviewText: You have to pay money to unlock core aspects of the game, including the actual Campaign and Skirmish modes. Now, I have no problem with DLC, or even microtransactions, as long as you're getting something ADDITIONAL to an otherwise well-featured game. But this is just penny-pinching here. They've clearly stripped several aspects of the game away, and then forced you to pay to unlock core features.\n\nThis is basically the PC equivalent of on-disc DLC.""

reviewText:
Well....i like town building - war mongering games. From basic ones like Travian, to complex ones like Dawn of Fantasy , Clash of Clans and else.

Dawn of Fantasy is a good game, but i am skeptical to say its worthwhile.
three points kill this game : First : Combat is stupid and bad...its frustrating to play, units are dumb, combat is slow, you need no strategy most of times...its plain, dull and boring.
2- Pay2Win, crowns when i first saw them and got them from missions made me happy, then i realized that most things need crowns and even if you keep repeating boring missions or pvp you will never have enough.
3-Low building diversity, your castle is pretty, you have like 20 slots to build in each area..and  like 8 buildings...its odd, seems like its a broken system, i cant explain.

So...if you compare the gameplay of travian or clash of clans, this game is horrible....its just has some cool graphics, pretty town and world map....

overall i would give a ...well, sorry a 4 of 10.
